intro: Lacara villosa, commonly known as the hairy lacara, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
